item.title: Sr Database Modeler/Database Development Consultant
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Remote Banking & Shared Services provides modern software driven banking experiences for CIBC\'s personal and small business banking clients by putting our clients at the center of all that we do .You’ll be at the heart of CIBC’s digital transformation, successfully delivering complex, enterprise-scale projects.

As a Sr. Data Modeler you will translate business needs into Logical data models supporting long-term solutions and work with the Application Development team to implement data strategies, build data flows and develop conceptual data models. You will create logical data model using best practices to ensure high data quality and reduced redundancy and optimize and update logical data models to support new and existing projects as well as maintain conceptual, logical and physical data models along with corresponding metadata.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Develop best practices for standard naming conventions and coding practices to ensure consistency of data models.

  • Recommend opportunities for reuse of data models in new environment and perform reverse engineering of physical data models from databases and SQL scripts.

  • Analyze data-related system integration challenges and propose appropriate solutions and develop data models according to company standards.

  • Relationship Building- Strong relationship with all technology partners required  with professional high quality team building for the assigned portfolio. You will liaise and interact with Architects, Solution design, Development and QA as part of the daily management of the portfolio.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate 5+ years of experience as a Data Modeler who is proficient in LDM, PM, SQL, Oracle. You have a solid experience in evaluating data models and physical databases for variances and discrepancies and validate business data objects for accuracy and completeness.

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information.

  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making

  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan.

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-20 Dundas St. W., 6th

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

item.title: Cloud Consultant - Big Data
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

In this role, you will join the CIBC’s Big Data team in a Senior Cloud Consultant capacity and you will provide subject matter expertise to Big Data Cloud initiatives as they relate to the design, implementation and support of Azure cloud technologies and tooling.  This role will  require good knowledge on CIBC Cloud offerings and will be representing the big data team in the Cloud Design Authority forum.  As a member of CIBC’s Big Data team you will provide technical leadership, standards, best practices, review and support with TO requirements to Big Data Project teams during design, build, configuration, implementation and maintenance phases of the Cloud projects. You will work closely with other Big Data tech leads to provide guidance on Cloud project implementations.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Leadership & Communication – Collaborate with senior leaders and tech leads across the team and make informed recommendations to enhance Big Data related solutions. Weigh business needs against technology offerings, security concerns and CIBC roadmap to provide solution recommendations which are practical and achievable.

  • Develop & Design – Lead or coach the design and development of Big Data projects in Cloud

  • Solution Design: Promote awareness and understanding of solutions being proposed by attending project and program meetings, influencing planning, designing, leading and facilitating forums and discussions with business partners, designers, architects, developers and vendors as needed. Attend TO Requirements sessions and help bridge the gap between the application delivery team and the TO Solutioning team.

  • Mentor and Coach – Mentor and Coach tech leads and developers on best cloud practices at CIBC and help bridge the gap on cross tech team collaboration.

  • Managing Multiple Priorities: Manage multiple concurrent objectives, projects or activities. Effective judgment in prioritizing and time allocation. Ability to process information with high levels of accuracy.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience :       

    • 4+  years of hands-on expertise with Azure or other Cloud provider technologies. It’s an asset if you have relevant Azure certifications such as AZ-203, AZ-303, AZ-304, AZ-400 or equivalent knowledge.

    • 2 years hands on experience with Data Cloud services such as Azure Data Factory, Databricks,  Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Blob, SQL Server

    • Good knowledge of Azure Devops, Azure Monitor, Azure Synapse (Formerly SQL Data Warehouse), Azure Data Catalogue/Purview, CosmosDB.

    • Good knowledge of Azure Identity and Access management (RBAC, AAD, SPN).

    • It’s an asset if you have hands on working experience with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop, Hive, HBase, Oozie, HiveQL, Hive UDFs, Sqoop, Spark, Impala.

    • It’s an asset if you have hands-on development expertise with Core Java or Scala as well as Python and SQL.

  • You’re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends. You are passionate about technology.

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success.  You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.

  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of a team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision. You are passionate about client service - You want the work you do each day to result in a positive client experience.

  • You have a degree/diploma in Computer Science.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, and individual development planning.

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-55 Yonge Street, 3rd

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

item.title: Consultant, Application Development - ETL/Big Data
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You\'ll Be Doing

You’ll be joining CIBC’s Financial Crimes Technology team. You’ll be at the heart of CIBC’s Financial Crimes Technology transformation, successfully delivering complex, enterprise-scale projects involving multiple back-end systems. As a Data engineer, you will build, implement and maintain easy, flexible, and personalized solutions that enhance the end-user experience across AML, Information Security, Corporate Security, Fraud and Compliance. You are a strong team player able to interact effectively with both business and technical members of the team, and mentor junior developers

How You\'ll Succeed

  • Collaborative Development: Convert specifications about business requirements into programming instructions. Conduct impact analysis, and analysis of organizational needs & goals, for development and implementation of application systems. Dedication to good development practices like unit testing, code reviews and pull requests

  • Programming Ability: Develop, review, analyze, and modify programming systems, including encoding, testing, debugging and installing for a large-scale system. Provide support for existing production applications, and recommend opportunities for enhancements.

  • Code Quality: Contribute to code-review sessions and ensure overall code quality aligns with business and project requirements. Monitor production and user acceptance testing support to troubleshoot complex problems on applications and technologies

Who You Are

  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.

  • You’re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.

  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision.

  • You can demonstrate experience in: developing data pipelines with Apache Spark or Spark SQ.

    • 2–3 years Spark Development experience using Java, Scala, SparkSQL, Hive

    • Knowledge of Cloudera Big Data ecosystem (HDFS, MapReduce, Sqoop, Impala, HUE)

    • streaming technologies such as Kafka and Spark Streaming

    • ingestion using Apache NIFI

    • Agile development (JIRA / Confluence)

    • revision control systems, such as BitBucket of Github

    • containerization (Docker) and orchestration (Kubernetes)

    • developing and deploying applications to the cloud environment

    • Linux and shell scripting

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect : Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, and individual development planning

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-33 Yonge Street, 3rd

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

item.title: Sr. Consultant, Business Systems Analysis (Big Data)
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

You’ll lead complex projects to design strategic solutions aligned to CIBC’s enterprise architecture roadmap. As a Senior Consultant, Business Systems Analyst, you’ll support collaborative end-to-end project implementation and act as a subject matter expert in both business and technology following values, principles and practices of application delivery. You’ll participate in all phases of application delivery with a diverse team to create and build flexible, innovative solutions that deliver a best in class client experience.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Understanding Requirements - Work closely with Business Partners to lead the analysis of client processes and functional requirements to prepare documentation and communicate the information. Knowledge of and ability to utilize use case analysis, define and document business & solution requirements. Provide SME advice and direction to internal and external stakeholders to ensure that the requirements work packages are appropriately defined.
  • Technical Requirements - Knowledge and experience with Hadoop, MS Azure, SQL, and Big Data tools
  • Proven Leadership and Mentorship - Support end-to-end project implementation and act as a subject matter expert in business analysis. Drive to collaborate and support individuals and cross-functional teams to resolve organizational, operational and process problems and coach more junior level resources within an waterfall and agile environments.

Who You Are

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success.  You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of a team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, and individual development planning.

What You Need to Know

item.title: Senior Risk Data Analyst
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

Senior Risk Data Analyst, Risk Data Management Office

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Ensure the integrity of credit risk measures of capital markets products by carrying out daily quality assurance procedures and controls, and analyzing the drivers of the trading credit risk exposure changes.
  • Partner with Risk Management and Technology stakeholders to plan system enhancements in support of rising business and regulatory requirements related to the accuracy of credit risk data and credit risk measurements in the trading credit risk system.
  • Assist in the maintenance of controls related to the integrity of risk data. Conduct ongoing data quality reviews and ensure that new initiatives meet the standards required to support the business unit’s objectives and overall controls.
  • Cross train extensively with other trading credit risk quality assurance group members in order to extend their product knowledge, understand the trading credit risk system, and provide seamless backup support.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Experienced - Solid knowledge of financial markets, OTC derivative products and their valuations, and trading room activities and systems knowledge gained through related experience.
  • Knowledgeable - Strong knowledge of risk management terminology and principles. Knowledge of the associated credit risk management processes and risk measures is an asset.
  • Analytical - Experience with data analysis tools (incl. data analyst skill-level using SQL, VBA programming)

Who You Are

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • You\'re driven to succeed. You are motivated by accomplishing your goals and delivering your best to make an impact.
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You’re a certified professional. Hold the certification or working towards CFA / FRM
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

item.title: Senior Consultant, Data Security Services
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

Job Overview

As a Senior Consultant, you will join CIBC\'s Information Security department to continue our journey and evolve the enterprise wide Application and Data Security programs, which strive to ensure that all applications and data across the enterprise have security built into their life cycle, thereby enhancing CIBC’s overall security landscape and protecting Our Bank, Our Clients, and Our Employees.

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Provide strategic thought leadership, building and regularly updating our banks strategic roadmaps and product backlogs for the domain of Data Security.

  • Oversee multiple data security projects and managing stakeholders to meet the project timelines and compliance requirements.\\

  • Lead the evaluation of new and proposed security systems and technologies to improve data protection of enterprise critical assets and Digital Crown Jewels.

  • Collaborate with key architecture, development, operations and infrastructure stakeholders to implement continuous improvements, identify new business requirements and govern the effectiveness of data security services and controls

  • Act as a trusted advisor and security ambassador, influencing the enterprise teams to build security into their design, operating and development pipelines.

  • Direct the review, development, testing and implementation of security plans, products and control techniques

  • Support and promote the security culture and strategy while influencing infrastructure and application design activities.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Service Governance - Manage and oversee the development and maintenance of strategic roadmaps for the domain of Data Security. Collaborate with various stakeholders on requirements, develop business cases and lead subsequent projects (including POCs) as product owner to support the strategy. Maintain a continuous improvement mindset, always looking for opportunities for efficiency and to enhance the security of the domain.

  • Communication – Build and present documentation to executive management aimed at communicating benefits of proposed security programs, as well as on current potential risks and providing recommendations. Provide awareness and training to the application developments teams of the benefits of web application layer protection services, data protection services, code scanning services, etc. Assess business needs against potential risks and provide your recommendations to enhance our information security landscape.

  • Advisory and Relationship Management - Working with the broader team, act as a trusted advisor to influence the application development, operational and infrastructure teams to build security into their design, development and scanning techniques, and to prioritize security vulnerabilities identified using a risk-based approach. Assist in the the identification, assessment, reporting, and management of security risks and design flaws identified in key applications with practical and achievable recommendations.  Stay on top of the latest threat landscape and maintain relationships with peers from other banks. Manage the vendor relationship for security services and tools used within the domains of Data Security.

  • Data Protection Services - Manage data protection and data security service management related activities, including scheduling, consulting, onboarding, service governance and improvement. Measure the quality of the service protection and conduct threat update reviews, analysis of logs, trends and usage reports. Drive the improvement in the level of security protection for our enterprise data, specifically Digital Crown Jewels and critical assets..

Who You Are

  • You bring passion for industry application security, vulnerability management and data security standards and best practices.

  • You can demonstrate experience in data security concepts in a senior level role. You have implemented data protection methodologies to ensure secure design of applications and protection of confidential data. You have been a key contributor or have led data security initiatives (i.e. encryption/tokenization of data (at rest, in flight, in use), data loss prevention) and have a working understanding of data governance and data privacy concepts.

  • You have the ability to develop strong relationships across various levels of an organization to bring about a positive result and communicate requirements effectively.

  • You’re a certified professional. You have current accreditation and good standing CISSP, CISA, or CISM designation

  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.

  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in a meaningful way.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

**Prior to starting in this role, security checks, including a criminal record check must be successfully completed to the satisfaction of CIBC. An annual criminal record check may also be required.

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto 55 Yonge Street, 11th

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

item.title: Sr. Consultant, Application Delivery Data Protection Lead
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You\'ll Be Doing

You’ll be a key part of an innovative, “first to market” technology culture, contributing to CIBC’s Enterprise Security Technology (EST) team. As a Senior Consultant in Application Delivery, you’ll be responsible for delivery of projects in the technical design, integration and deployment of data protection and information security systems. You’ll build flexible, and scalable solutions for Information Security that protects the digital crown jewel applications and enhance data security throughout data life cycle. You have extensive experience in application delivery as well as in data protection technologies and solution both on-premise and in-cloud environments.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Design: Act as a SME (subject matter expert) on data security and data protection, you would be leading the work based on the business requirements, you estimate and design solutions for assigned work packages and coordinate for end-to-end implementation of technology solutions. Lead the design and development of cost-effective and innovative solutions to meet business objectives. Work with other internal teams like business system analysts, developers, Enterprise Architecture, Information Security, Security Risk Advisors, Cloud Engineering, and such to understand the requirements and work on implementing and roll out of solutions.

  • Programming Ability: this role will not be doing programming but must have enough programming experience to be able to design meaningful, reusable, scalable, and efficient solutions and work with lead developers to implement their designs.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate 7+ years of hands-on experience and knowledge in application design and delivery, expertise and experience in information security solutions and technologies as well as a pulse on innovative technology. Must-have skills: hands-on experience with application delivery life cycle (agile, waterfall, Scrum), Linux/Unix, RDBMS (Oracle or MS-SQL Server), Big Data (Hadoop), integration patterns, API, data protection (encryption, masking). information security. Nice-to-have: computer networks, high availability, Microsoft Azure or other cloud platforms, Spark, strategy and roadmap.

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success.  You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.

  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of a team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision. You are passionate about client service -  You want  the work you do each day to result in a  positive client experience.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

​What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, and individual development planning.

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Toronto-150 York Street, 3rd

Regular

Weekly Hours

item.title: Director, Application Development (Data Analytics & Reporting)
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

You’ll be joining CIBC’s Private Wealth Management (PWM) Technology group within Wealth Management and will be an integral part of CIBC’s technology transformation. As the Director, Application Development, you will act as the technical subject matter expert with oversight and accountability for Business Analysis, Production Support, Development, QA and Vendor Relations for the Data Analytics & Reporting applications and services supporting the Private Wealth Management business group. With a strong focus on technology strategy, delivery approaches and business acumen, you’ll lead a team delivering technology changes and supporting requirements that align with both the Private Wealth Management line of business and the Wealth Management Technology (WMT) mandates.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Technical Leadership – Drive PWM technology solutions with respect to Data Analytics & Reporting as part of an integrated business and technology roadmap. Design, develop, implement/execute and support technology strategies which include:  Data and Business Analytics strategy, Cloud strategy, Application Modernization/CCR strategy, Application Health-check and Innovation strategy, Process Automation (QA), DevOps adoption.  Provide oversight and leadership of end to end technology solutions involving development, business analysis, QA, vendor relations, production support and development functions supporting the business to meet their objectives.

  • People Leadership – Lead and coach a team of Business Systems Analysts, Application Developers, and Application Support Specialists building on existing individual capabilities and bringing new talent into the team to meet business and technology objectives. Develop your team, maximizing their contributions, encourage out of the box thinking and professional growth. Create a positive work environment through being an effective role model and by championing CIBC’s mission, vision and values, ensuring compliance with policies, standards, guidelines and controls, applying policies fairly and consistently so employees understand what to expect. Manage performance by providing fair and accurate formal and informal feedback, identifying and removing obstacles to performance and by explaining how performance expectations align with business priorities.

  • Relationship Management – Work closely with clients and business partners to develop, test, plan and implement application enhancements. Become familiar for all CIBC enterprise development practices, standards and governance controls for other CIBC groups and technology vendors. Advise on emerging technical trends in the industry and at CIBC, and ensure application services best practices reflect appropriate technological developments for a competitive business position.  Collaborate and support the other PWM Technology teams in the delivery of technology modernization that address the strategic and operational business partner agenda and the CIBC technology strategy.  Analyze technical risk to support business recommendations and make adjustments to internal operations as necessary to improve performance of the Application Delivery and support teams. 

 

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience with: 8+ years\' experience leading, designing, developing, implementing and supporting both in house applications as well as vendor developed and ASP. You have led the creation of a data strategy and associated roadmap and led execution across multiple technologies and projects. Experience in most of the following: Languages (Net, C#, C/C++, Foxpro, Python, Java, Javascript), Databases (Oracle, SQL Server, Sybase), Cloud (Azure, AWS), ETL (Informatica, SSIS), O/S (Sun Solaris, Microsoft Windows), Schedulers etc. (Feedhub, MFTS, Autosys) and Tools (source control/issue management: Git, TFS, JIRA, Azure DevOps), Data and Business Analytics, Application Modernization/CCR, Application Health-check and Innovation, Process Automation (QA) and DevOps adoption. You will utilize your breadth of knowledge to identify opportunities to optimize, modernize, retire or consolidate a large number of applications spanning numerous technologies. You are a seasoned people leader with the ability to coach and help develop other team members. It’s an Asset if:  You have good understanding of the Wealth Management business and have worked in a capacity supporting the business. You have a degree/diploma in: Computer Science, Engineering, and/or a related field.

  • You have a solid understanding of: Managing vendor applications, roadmaps, testing, and implementation. Designing and implementing applications for cloud. Strong knowledge of Agile methodology and experience working in a Scrum team.

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.

  • You embrace and champion change: You’ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.  You empower and enable your team to make continuous improvement, go above and beyond, and deliver results.

  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of a team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto 55 Yonge Street, 2nd

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

item.title: Sr. Salesforce Developer
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

You’ll be a key part of an innovative, “first to market” technology culture, contributing to CIBC’s CRM transformation. As a Salesforce Developer you’ll own all technical aspects of Salesforce, including data migrations, data quality, systems integrations, 3rd party applications, AppExchange products, and custom code. You’ll build easy, flexible, and personalized banking solutions that enhance client experience and change the way that people bank. 

How You’ll Succeed

  • Collaborative Development: Performs technical analysis, design, configuration, and implementation support for system integrations and Salesforce customization\'s. Create actionable technical documentation based on gathered business requirements. Assist with scoping and planning of various CRM related projects and initiatives
  • Programming Ability: Ownership of all technical aspects of Salesforce, including data migrations, data quality, systems integrations, 3rd party applications, AppExchange products, and custom code
  • Code Quality: Responsible for developing custom applications and code, Lightning Components, Apex, Triggers, and other technologies to build customized solutions that support business requirements and drive key business decisions. Writes, tests, analyzes, and implements high quality code according to specifications.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in: 5+ years of hands-on development experience with Salesforce. as well as a pulse on innovative technology; Technical experience with: Salesforce architecture and API, Writing Ligtning components and Apex classes and triggers. Demonstrative success with Salesforce integration projects. You have experience of integrating Salesforce with other applications via real-time, batch, sync, async. It’s an advantage if you have experience writing Salesforce DX and Financial Services Cloud experience. You have Strong business analysis and functional experience, including requirements gathering, creating/deploying solutions to end users. Technical project management experience preferably in Agile software development mythologies
  • You have a certifications in: Certified Salesforce Developer, Certified Salesforce Advanced Developer a plus.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success.  You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of a team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision. You are passionate about client service -  You want  the work you do each day to result in a  positive client experience.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, and individual development planning.
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-150 York Street, 3rd

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

item.title: Sr. Application Developer
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

You’ll be joining CIBC’s Captital Markets/Wealth Management Operations Technology Team.  As a Senior Application Developer, you’ll assist in developing, testing and supporting the implementation of cross-functional, multi-platform application systems. Within a team of senior team members, you’ll broaden your technical skills and help build the bank of the future.

How You’ll Succeed

  • You can demonstrate experience with 1-3 years of practical software development experience utilizing BI and ETL tools.  This role requires effective solution and design expertise needed to solve complex problems.   Ideally, you are the one with:
    • Experience with COGNOS BI
    • Experience with Informatica
    • Experience in database management systems - preferably Oracle
    • Experience with job schedulers – preferably Autosys
    • Experience with production support activities/duties
    • Demonstrated ability to learn new technologies, applications and systems
    • Experience with/Knowledge of Broadridge Financial Service (BFS)
    • Experience within the Financial Services sector
  • Relationship Building- Required to respond to client\'s inquires and requests, providing professional high quality customer service for the assigned portfolio to ensure client satisfaction. You will liase and interact with clients as part of the daily management of the portfolio.
  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.
  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results.
  • You\'re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.

Who You Are

  • You\'re passionate about people. You find meaning in relationships, and surround yourself with a diverse network of partners. You build trust through respect and authenticity.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-483 Bay St;. 8th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

item.title: Application Developer
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions so you feel empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and feel truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

The Application Developer is responsible for the detailed technical design and development of applications using Java technology platforms. The role performs tasks of technical depth and breadth, utilizing a solid understanding of business dynamics to conduct impact analysis and provide feedback on problems with recommended solutions. In addition, this role maintains production environment through incident triage and defect resolution.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Application Development: Implement application enhancements by designing and developing efficient solutions. Collaborate with Testing teams in ensuring the quality of the initiatives

  • Production Support: maintain production systems through incident triage, change and problem management. Identify and implement process improvements and bring in application efficiencies. Collaborate with various technical teams and vendors in ensuring production stability

  • Relationship Building- Required to respond to client\'s inquires and requests, providing professional high quality customer service for the assigned portfolio to ensure client satisfaction. You will liaise and interact with clients as part of the daily management of your portfolio.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in: hands-on development and support exposure to technologies like Java/J2EE, NodeJs, Angular, APIs, microservices, Unix and Oracle. Knowledge of IBM technologies like Identity manager (ITIM), security manager (ISAM) and LDAP would be an asset

  • You\'re passionate about people. You find meaning in relationships, and surround yourself with a diverse network of partners. You build trust through respect and authenticity.

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
